etymology.description: semantic 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic 兌(兑) (duì, "exchange") = speak or explain through speech -> final meaning "speak"
etymology.interpretation: The character 說(說) (shuō, "speak") combines the speech radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") with the phonetic component 兌(兑) (duì, "exchange"), emphasizing verbal communication or the exchange of spoken words.
etymology.simplification: 說(說) was simplified to 说(說) by replacing the full 言(言, "speech") component with its simplified form 讠(讠, "speech") to streamline writing while maintaining phonetic similarity.

examples.chinese: 他总是说诚实的话(他總是說誠實的話)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì shuō chéngshí de huà.

examples.chinese: 妈妈说(媽媽說)，请你安静(請你安靜)。
朋友说(朋友說)，我们该努力工作(我們該努力工作)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒu shuō, wǒmen gāi nǔlì gōngzuò.
examples.english: A friend said, we should work hard.
